Crafting Magic Items.name: Crafting Magic Items
Crafting Magic Items.text:
Crafting Magic Items

Characters with the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Artificer]{Artificer Edge} can imbue their powers into @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanedevice00]{arcane devices} for later use or give them to their allies. This ties up their own @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000001]{Power Points}, however, and such creations are temporary.

With enough time and resources, however, an artificer can create more permanent items of wonder, and best of all he doesn’t have to tie up his own Power Points in the process!

The Crafting Process

After each week spent Crafting, the artificer makes an @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Occult]{Occult} roll for each item he’s working on. A success makes 500 gp worth of progress toward its completion, and a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} makes 1,000 gp progress.

If the roll is failed, no progress is made on that item but the crafter may try again the following week. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure}, a mishap loses the creator 500 gp worth of progress!

  • Ammunition: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Arrows]{Arrows}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sling Stones]{sling stones}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Bolts]{bolts}, or other types of ammunition are enchanted in batches of 12 at a time. If it can be recovered, each projectile has a 50% chance of remaining intact once fired.

Requirements

A character can create any of the items listed in this book if she has the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Artificer]{Artificer Edge}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04downtime000000]{Downtime}, the item to be enchanted, access to a workshop, and any spells and materials listed in the item’s Craft entry.

The Item: Only items of quality craftsmanship are typically given permanent @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06enchantments00]{enchantments}. Armor, shields, weapons, and other permanent items must be of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{masterwork} quality.

Potions, scrolls, and wands have no additional cost, but other permanent items should be exceptional examples of their type, and cost 50% more than usual.

Requirements: The @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Artificer]{artificer} must have any powers and materials listed in the item’s Craft entry. Materials are precious gems, metals, powders, oils, or other rare components represented by the listed gold value listed (typically half the item’s value if purchased from others).

Workshop: A simple workshop allows a crafter to work on a single item at a time. A standard workshop allows him to work on two, and a grand workshop allows the creation of up to three items at a time.

Example: Lini's Gift

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Lini]{Lini} the druid wants to craft @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Slippers of Spider Climbing]{slippers of spider climbing} for @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Merisiel]{Merisiel} the rogue. She has access to a standard workshop and can create two things at once, so she decides to make a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Potion of Major Healing]{Potion of Major Healing} at the same time.

The slippers have a Craft cost of 2,400. The potion’s crafting cost is 150. Lini has @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wall Walker]{Wall Walker} (a requirement for the slippers) and gathers 2,550 gp worth of other materials.

After a week’s work, she rolls and gets a success. That’s 500 gp worth of progress toward their creation. Now she rolls for the potion of healing. She’s successful, and since its cost is less than 500 gp, it’s finished and ready to use.

Lini continues on the slippers the next week and gets a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} on her roll. That’s a total of 1,500 gp progress. The third and fourth weeks she gets another success, giving her another 1,000 gp worth of progress. The slippers are finished and she gifts them to her friend— who she warns only to use them for the good of the Pathfinder Society!

Enchantments.name: Enchantments
Enchantments.text:
Enchantments

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Masterwork} @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{armor}, shields, and weapons can be enchanted with the qualities listed below. Each item can hold five points worth of enchantments. The number of points a particular quality takes is listed in parentheses after its name.

Note: An item cannot be enchanted with the same quality more than once.

Named Items: The named magic armor, shields, and weapons named in the rest of this chapter can’t have additional enchantments.

Armor & Shield Qualities

Aegis (1): Armor only. Increases the protective bonus of the armor by +1.

Price: 3,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{Protection}, 1,500 gp.

Animated (3): Shield only. Once per encounter, an animated shield can be loosed to defend its wielder. For the next three rounds, it hovers near its owner, following him if he moves and granting its @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Parry} and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{cover} bonus as usual without needing to be held. Its type still applies for purposes of Armor Interference or Restriction.

Price: 10,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly}, 5,000 gp.

Arrow Deflection (1): Shield only. Ranged attacks against the bearer suffer an additional −1 penalty, regardless of the attacker's position (front, rear, etc).

Price: 3,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{Deflection}, 1,500 gp.

Deflecting (1): Shield only. Increase the shield’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Parry} bonus increased by +1.

Price: 4,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{Deflection}, 2,000 gp.

Energy Resistance (1): Armor or shield. Grants @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Environmental Resistance]{environmental resistance} against a single energy type, determined at creation, to a piece of armor or a shield. Damage from that source is reduced by 4 when the armor is worn, and the hero adds +4 when resisting any effect tied to that element.

A leather jerkin of energy resistance (Cold), for example, helps its wearer avoid @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Fatigue} from @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{exposure} and damage from any attack with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping} of cold, ice, frost, etc.

Price: 2,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{Environmental Protection}, 1,000 gp.

Etherealness (2): Armor only. On command, the wearer of this armor becomes ethereal, gaining minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Intangibility]{Intangibility}. The character can remain ethereal for as long as desired, but once he returns to normal, he cannot use this ability again for 24 hours.

Price: 49,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Intangibility]{Intangibility}, 24,500 gp.

Fortification (2): Armor only. Fortified armor is more likely to turn away a lethal blow. The wearer gains a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{free reroll} on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Soak} rolls.

Price: 5,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost Trait}, 2,500 gp.

Glamered (0): Armor only. Upon command, as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action}, a piece of glamered armor changes shape and appearance to assume the form of a normal piece of clothing. The armor retains all of its properties when it is so disguised.

Price: 900 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Illusion]{Illusion}, 450 gp.

Reflecting (4): Shield only. The shield’s surface is completely reflective. Once per day, the wielder can reflect any power that affects her by making a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} roll (at −2 if the casting roll got a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}). If successful the caster suffers the full effects of the power as if he had been the original target.

Price: 16,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{Dispel}, 8,000 gp.

Spell Resistance (4): Armor only. The wearer gains the benefits of minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{arcane protection}.

Price: 16,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{Arcane Protection}, 8,000 gp.

Weapon Qualities

Accurate (1): The weapon grants the user +1 in the skill required to use it @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Fighting]{Fighting}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting}, or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics}).

Price: 4,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost Trait}, 2,000 gp.

Bane (1): When used against a specific type of creature (dwarf, goblin, elemental, etc), a bane weapon has +2 @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{AP} and its damage die increases one type.

Price: 3,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Smite]{Smite}, 1,500 gp.

Brutal (2): The weapon is considered a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Heavy Weapon}.

Price: 5,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Smite]{Smite}, 2,500 gp.

Dancing (4): Melee weapon only. The wielder can command the weapon to dance once per encounter as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited free action}. It animates immediately, attacking as a character for up to five rounds. It uses its master’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Action Card} and attack skill, and rolls two of its normal damage dice for damage. The weapon can fly at Pace 10 and counts as an ally for the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Gang Up} bonus.

Price: 20,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly}, 10,000 gp.

Damaging (1): The weapon’s damage increases by +1.

Price: 3,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Smite]{Smite}, 1,500 gp.

Distance (1): Ranged weapons only. Decrease any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Range penalties} by one when using this weapon.

Price: 2,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Farsight]{Farsight}, 1,000 gp.

Elemental (1): The weapon causes damage with an energy @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}—acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic (chosen by creator).

Price: 2,000 gp. Craft: Damaging power with the appropriate energy @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}, 1,000 gp.

Keen (1): The weapon is exceptionally sharp, giving it @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Armor Piercing} +2.

Price: 3,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}, 1,500 gp.

Light (1): The weapon casts light in a Medium Blast Template. The user activates the illumination with her will as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action}.

Price: 2,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{Light}, 1,000 gp.

Mighty Cleaving (2): Two-handed melee weapon only. The user gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Sweep]{Sweep} Edge.

Price: 10,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Warrior's Gift]{Warrior's Gift}, 5,000 gp.

Returning (1): Thrown weapons only. The weapon returns to its user’s hand at the end of her turn.

Price: 3,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{Conjure item}, 1,500 gp.

Speed (3): If a melee weapon, the user gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Frenzy]{Frenzy} Edge. For a ranged weapon, the user gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Rapid Shot]{Rapid Shot} Edge. If the weapon can be used either way, the choice must be made as the weapon is enchanted.

Price: 16,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sloth/Speed]{Speed}, 8,000 gp.

Throwing (1): Melee weapon only. The weapon can be thrown using @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing). Its @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} is 4/8/16.

Price: 3,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost Trait}, 1,500 gp.

Vicious (2): Melee weapon only. If the wielder hits with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} his damage increases by +4 (in addition to any bonus damage), but he must make a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor} roll or be @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}.

Price: 5,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Smite]{Smite}, 2,500 gp.

Vorpal (5): Blades only. A vorpal weapon ignores penalties for @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Called Shots} to the head. Anyone @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated} by a vorpal blade is decapitated!

Price: 50,000 gp. Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Smite]{Smite}, 25,000 gp.

Magic Items.name: Magic Items
Magic Items.text:
Magic Items

Each magic item lists its name and effects and the following additional entries.

Price is how much @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Artificer]{artificers} or merchants charge for the item, if they have them or are willing to sell them at all. Heroes without storefronts, contacts, and previous customers can usually sell items for half this value.

Weight is how much the item weighs.

Craft lists the requirements an individual with the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Artificer]{Artificer} Edge needs to make the item, along with any additional costs in gold or other resources. The cost of the enhancement determines the amount of Downtime required to create (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06craftingmagi00]{Crafting Magic Items}).

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armor000000000]{Armor}, shields, & Weapons-

Among the most prized magic items are magical armor, shields, and weapons.

Armor and Shields

Armor must be worn and a shield must be in hand to benefit from any special abilities.

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Masterwork}: Magic armor and shields are masterwork items, reducing their Min Str one die type.

Banded Mail of Luck

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Banded Mail of Luck]{See item here}

Ten 100-gp gems adorn this banded plate mail corselet (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06enchantments00]{Aegis}). Once per encounter, the wearer may force a foe to reroll a successful attack roll made against him. The wearer chooses which result is kept. The attacker may still benefit from any additional @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{rerolls}.

Price: 18,900 gp. Weight: 35 lbs.

Craft: Good aligned, 9,650 gp.

Celestial Armor

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Celestial Armor]{See item here}

This bright silver or gold chainmail (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06enchantments00]{Aegis}) is finely crafted and lightweight. It can be worn under normal clothing. Once per day its wearer gains the benefits of the minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly} power with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} of five minutes.

Price: 22,400 gp. Weight: 20 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly}, good aligned, 11,350 gp.

Helm of Comprehend Languages

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Helm of Comprehend Languages]{See item here}

This helmet grants its wearer the ability to understand the spoken words of any creature, read text in any language, and comprehend any magical writing.

Price: 5,200 gp. Weight: 3 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{Speak Language} , 2,600 gp.

Helm of Teleportation

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Helm of Teleportation]{See item here}

As a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited action}, a character wearing this helm may @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{teleport} (major) with the Greater Teleport @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifier} three times per day.

Price: 73,500 gp. Weight: 3 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{Teleport}; 36,750 gp.

Lion shield

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Lion Shield]{See item here}

The face of this heavy steel shield (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06enchantments00]{Deflecting}) is fashioned as a roaring lion’s head. Three times per day as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited free action}, the lion’s head can be commanded to bite. It attacks with the wielder’s @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} and causes 2d8, AP 2 damage.

Price: 9,170 gp. Weight: 15 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{Summon Ally}, 4,670 gp.

Rhino Hide

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Rhino Hide]{See item here}

This enchanted (@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore06magici.JournalEntryPage.06enchantments00]{Aegis}) thick leather jacket is made of rhino hide. In addition to its enhanced armor, the wearer adds +4 damage to one successful @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack in a turn in which he runs at least 5” (10 yards).

Price: 5,165 gp. Weight: 25 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{Boost/Lower Trait}, 2,600 gp.

Weapons

Weapons must be carried (either in a scabbard or in the hand) to grant their benefits.

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Masterworks}: All magical weapons are masterwork items, increasing their @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Armor Piercing (AP)} by 1.

Assassin’s Dagger

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Assassin's Dagger]{See item here}

The wielder adds +2 to damage rolls when successfully attacking a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Vulnerable} opponent or once he’s gotten @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{The Drop} on.

Price: 10,302 gp. Weight: 1lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{Darkness}, 5,302 gp.

Flame Tongue

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Flame Toungue]{See item here}

The wielder of this @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sword, Long]{Longsword} can cause it to burst into flame as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action}. When it does so, it causes +1 damage and can cast a flaming @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}, AP 2, as an action once per day (using @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} as the casting roll).

Price: 20,715 gp. Weight: 4 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}; 10,515 gp.

Holy Avenger

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Holy Avenger]{See item here}

This iron @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sword, Long]{Longsword} (Str+d10, AP 2) adds +1 to its user’s @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} rolls (+2 if wielded by a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Paladin]{paladin}). A paladin also gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Arcane Resistance]{Arcane Resistance} Edge, and may cast @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{Dispel} using @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} as an action three times per encounter.

Price: 120,630 gp. Weight: 4lbs.

Craft: Good aligned; 60,630 gp.

Javelin of Lightning

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Javelin of Lightning]{See item here}

When thrown, the javelin becomes a streak of lightning. The user places a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Stream Template} in front of himself. The attack does 4d6 electricity damage to anyone who fails to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{evade}. The javelin is consumed in the attack.

Price: 1,500 gp; Weight: 2 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}; 750 gp.

Luck blade

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Luck Blade]{See item here}

This plain-looking @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sword, Short]{Short Sword} grants the wielder the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Luck]{Luck} Edge. Some luck blades may contain d4−1 wishes! (GM’s call.) The user should never know how many are left, and once used, the wishes are gone forever. (See @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish}.)

Price: 22,060 gp (0 wishes), 62,360 (1 wish), 102,660 gp (2 wishes),142,960 gp (3 wishes); Weight: 2 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wish]{Wish}; 11,185 gp (0 wishes), 43,835 (1 wish), 76,485 gp (2 wishes),109,135gp (3 wishes).

Oathbow

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Oathbow]{See item here}

This elvencraft @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Bow (composite)]{composite longbow)} (+1 Shooting) whispers “Swift defeat to my enemies” in Elven when pulled. Once per day, the archer can swear aloud to slay a specific target (in Elvish). The bow responds “Death to those who have wronged me!” Attacking that target with the bow causes +d6 damage and the user gets a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{reroll} on his @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll.

The oathbow may only have one sworn enemy at a time. Once the wielder swears to slay a target, he cannot make a new oath until the target is slain or seven days have passed.

Price: 25,600 gp; Weight: 3lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Elf]{Elf}; 13,100 gp.

Potions

Potions are alchemical concoctions enchanted with arcane energies. Drinking the potion (an action) activates the power contained within immediately. Each potion can only contain one power, and each potion contains only one dose.

An individual can only benefit from one potion per round. If given more than one, roll randomly to see which one takes effect— all others are wasted.

A potion can be administered to an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated} or unconscious person (as an action).

Craft: The crafting cost of a minor potion is equal to its power’s Rank × the number of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Power Points} it uses; then multiply that total by 25 gp. A major potion doubles the final result (For example, a potion of minor healing without any modifiers is Novice (1) × 3 power point × 25 gp=75 gp). A potion's market price is double their cost to craft.

Scrolls

Scrolls contain magical words, runes, and glyphs a user can activate by reading them aloud.

Each scroll has @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powersummari00]{one power} inscribed onto it, including possible @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers} if listed in its description. A character must have the scroll in hand and may not read more than one scroll per turn.

Reading a scroll is an action and requires a Smarts roll or arcane skill roll (caster’s choice). If the roll is successful, the power activates and the scroll fades. A reader may try again if the rolls fails, but a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure} means the scroll crumbles to dust without activating the power.

Craft: The cost of a scroll is equal to its power’s Rank × the number of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Power Points} it uses; then multiply that total by 25 gp. A scroll of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt} with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{AP 2}, for example, is Novice (1) × 2 Power Points, × 25 gp= 50 gp. A scroll's market price is double its cost to craft.

Wands

A wand is a thin baton that casts a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powersummari00]{single power}, including any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers}, each time it's activated. To activate a wand, a character must point it in the direction of the target or area, and make a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Spellcasting]{arcane skill} roll (her choice) as an action. A failure uses a single charge. A @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Critical Failure} also causes @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Fatigue} to the wielder.

Wands are small and may be used in melee, while grappling, or other tight circumstances.

Charges: A wand has 25 charges when created, and cannot recharge. Each use consumes a charge.

Craft: The cost of a wand is equal to the cost per charge (using the same formula a for Scrolls) multiplied by the number of charges. A fully-charged wand of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{Dispel}, for example, costs (100 × 25) 2,500 gp. A wand's market price is double its cost to craft.

Each of the several kinds of figurines of wondrous power is a miniature statuette of a creature an inch or so high (with one exception). When the figurine is tossed down and the correct command word spoken, it becomes a living creature. The creature obeys and serves its owner, and unless otherwise stated, understands Common but does not speak.

If a figurine is broken or destroyed in its statuette form, it is forever ruined. If slain in animal form, the figurine simply reverts to a statuette that can be used again at a later time.

They can be used once per day for up to one hour. If slain, the lions cannot be brought back for one full week.

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Figurine of Wondrous Power, Ivory Goats]{Ivory Goats}: These figurines come in threes. Each goat looks slightly different from the others, and each has a different function:

  • The Goat of Traveling: A speedy and enduring mount equal to that of a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Horse, Heavy]{heavy horse} in every way except appearance. The goat can travel for a maximum of one day each week— continuously or in any combination of periods totaling 24 hours. At this point, or when the command word is uttered, it returns to its statuette form for no less than one day before it can again be used.
  • The Goat of Travail: This statuette becomes an enormous creature with the statistics of a nightmare (see the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08bestiary000000]{Bestiary}, or use the profile for the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-actors.Horse, Heavy]{Heavy Horse} in this book if it isn't available), with the addition of a pair of large, wicked horns (Str+d6). It can be called to life only once per month for up to 12 hours at a time.
  • The Goat of Terror: The proper command word causes this statuette to become a destrier-like mount with the statistics of a horned horse (Str+d8+2, may gore) and the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fear]{Fear} −2 special ability. It can be used once every two weeks for up to three hours per use.

Upon utterance of the command word, it grows to the size and specifications of a true elephant. The statuette can be used four times per month for up to 24 hours at a time.

This necklace features a brilliant-cut black gem on a silver chain. The wearer is immune to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{Poison}, though poisons active when the periapt is first donned still run their course.

Price: 27,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{Healing}; 13,500 gp.

Pearl OF power

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Pearl of Power, Novice]{See novice here}

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Pearl of Power, Seasoned]{See seasoned here}

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Pearl of Power, Veteran]{See veteran here}

Average in size and luster, this pearl allows the bearer to recast any one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powersummari00]{power} they’ve already cast that day (including any @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers}). The user must still make a skill roll to cast the power, but pays no Power Points.

The pearl only allows powers of the determined Rank or lower to be recast.

Price: 16,000 gp (Novice), 36,000 gp (Seasoned), or 64,000 (Veteran);

Weight: –.

Craft: Creator must be able to cast a spell of that level; 8,000 gp (Novice), 18,000 gp (Seasoned) or 32,000 (Veteran).

Pearl of the Sirens

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Pearl of the Sirens]{See item here}

The beautiful pearl (value of at least 1,000 gp) enables its possessor to breathe in water as if she were in clean, fresh air. Her swim @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} is 9 and she can cast spells and act underwater without hindrance.

Price: 15,300 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{Environmental Protection}; 8,150 gp.

Portable Hole

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Portable Hole]{See item here}

A portable hole is a circle of cloth spun from the webs of a phase spider interwoven with strands of ether and beams of starlight, resulting in a portable, extradimensional space.

The portable hole is two yards in diameter when unfolded, but the user can fold it to become as small as a pocket handkerchief. When fully opened, it accesses an extra-dimensional hole four yards deep. This hole can be picked up from inside or out by simply taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Either way, the entrance disappears, but anything inside the hole remains, traveling with the item.

It contains enough air for one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08sizetable00000]{Size} 0 creature for 10 minutes.

Price: 20,000 gp; Weight: – lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{Plane Shift}; 10,000 gp.

Robe OF Blending

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Robe of Blending]{See item here}

Once per day, this simple wool robe grants its wearer major @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{disguise} with the Size modifier. The user also gains the ability to speak and understand the basic racial languages of the chosen form.

Price: 8,400 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{Disguise}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{Speak Language}; 4,200 gp.

Robe OF Bone

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Robe of Bone]{See item here}

When worn by a character who can cast the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{Zombie} power, she sees small, undead figures embroidered in this robe's otherwise unremarkable fabric. The wearer can detach one figure per round, tossing it to the ground so that it rises into an actual undead creature. The robe doesn’t grant control of the being, but the wearer may spend one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Power Point} per creature to do so (no roll is required). The Power Points cannot be recovered until the creature is destroyed.

A newly created robe of bones has two embroidered figures of each of the following undead:

  • Human skeleton
  • Wolf skeleton
  • Heavy horse skeleton
  • Goblin zombie
  • Human zombie
  • Ogre zombie

Cost: 2,400 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{Zombie}; 1,200 gp.

Robe OF scintillating colors

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Robe of Scintillating Colors]{See item here}

On command, this colorful robe illuminates a 5” (10 yard) radius centered on the wearer. Up to ten times per day, the user can speak the command word to cast a minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{Stun} on a single target up to 10” (20 yards) distant. The wearer of this robe benefits from minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{Deflection} (ranged).

Price: 27,000 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{Deflection},@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{Stun}; 13,500 gp.

Robe OF Useful Items

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Robe of Useful Items]{See item here}

A character who dons this simple robe notes it’s adorned with small cloth patches of various shapes. Only the wearer can see these patches, recognize them for what items they become, and detach them.

One patch can be detached each round as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{limited free actions}. Doing so causes it to become an actual item as indicated below.

A newly created robe of useful items always has two each of the following patches:

  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Dagger/Knife]{Knife}
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Lantern, bullseye (10" cone)]{Bullseye lantern (full and lit)}
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Mirror, small steel]{Mirror} (a polished 2×4-foot steel mirror)
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Pole, 12']{Pole (12-foot length)}
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Rope, hemp (10"/20 yards)]{Hempen rope (50-foot coil)}
  • @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sack]{Sack}

In addition, the robe has several other patches. Roll 4d4 for the number of other patches and then roll d12 for each on the table below to determine its nature.

Useful Items
d12 Result
1 Bag of 100 gold pieces
2 Door, iron (up to 10 ft. wide and 10 ft. high and barred on one side— must be placed upright, attaches and hinges itself)
3 Gems, 10 (100 gp value each)
4 Ladder, wooden (24 ft. long)
5 Mule (with saddle bags)
6 Pit, open (12 ft. by 12 ft. by 12 ft.)
7 Potion of major healing
8 Rowboat (12 ft. long)
9 Minor scroll of one randomly determined spell
10 War dogs, pair (treat as dogs)
11 Window (2 ft. by 4 ft., up to 2 ft. deep)
12 Portable ram

Price: 7,000 gp; Weight: 1 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{Conjure Item}; 3,500 gp.

ROPE OF climbing

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Rope of Climbing]{See item here}

This strange, magical 20-yard rope is no thicker than a wand but strong enough to support 3,000 lbs. When held and commanded, it snakes its way forward, fastening itself securely wherever the user wants at @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} 3. It can unfasten and return upon command as well.

The rope may also negate situational penalties to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (climbing) rolls where its magical properties can benefit the user (GM’s call).

Price: 3,000 gp; Weight: 3 lbs.

Craft: 1,500 gp.

Rope OF entanglement

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Rope of Entanglement]{See item here}

This 10-yard long coil of rope looks completely ordinary. On command, however, it lashes out to half its length to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Entangle} a victim.

The rope grants its user the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Entangle]{Entangle} power, and is cast with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing).

The rope is destroyed if severed.

Price: 21,000 gp; Weight: 5 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Entangle]{Entangle}; and 10,500 gp.

Scarab, golembane

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Scarab, Golembane]{See item here}

This beetle-shaped pin enables its wearer to detect any golem within 10” (20 yards), although he must concentrate in order for the detection to take place (as an action).

It enables its possessor to ignore up to 4 points of any golem’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Armor} when attacking with weapons, unarmed attacks, or natural weapons.

Price: 2,500 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{Detect Arcana}; 1,250 gp.

Scarab of Protection

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Scarab of Protection]{See item here}

This device is a silver medallion in the shape of a beetle. If it is held for one round, an inscription appears on its surface letting the holder know it’s a protective device.

When worn, it can absorb up 12 @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Energy Drain]{Energy Drain} attacks. After that it turns to powder and is destroyed.

Price: 38,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{Arcane Protection}; 19,000 gp.

Slippers of spider Climbing

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Slippers of Spider Climbing]{See item here}

While worn, a pair of these slippers grants the wearer the minor @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wall Walker]{Wall Walker} power. Severely slippery surfaces— icy, oiled, or greased surfaces— make these slippers useless.

Price: 4,800 gp; Weight: 1/2 lb.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Wall Walker]{Wall walker}; 2,400 gp.

Sovereign Glue

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sovereign Glue]{See item here}

This pale amber substance is thick and viscous. Because of its particular powers, it can be contained only in a flask whose inside has been coated with a special salve.

When found, a flask holds anywhere from 1 to 7 ounces of the stuff (1d8−1, minimum 1).

One ounce covers one square foot of surface, bonding virtually any two substances together in a permanent union. It takes one round to set. If the objects are pulled apart (as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Free Action}) before that time has elapsed, that application of the glue loses its stickiness and is worthless.

If the glue is allowed to set, attempting to separate the two bonded objects has no effect, except when @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Universal Solvent]{Universal Solvent} is applied to the bond. Sovereign glue is dissolved by universal solvent.

Price: 2,400 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 1,200 gp.

Stone of Good Luck (Luckstone)

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Stone of Good Luck]{See item here}

The owner of a luckstone gains the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Luck]{Luck} Edge while it’s in their possession.

Price: 20,000 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 10,000 gp.

Sustaining Spoon

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sustaining Spoon]{See item here}

If this unremarkable utensil is placed in an empty container, the vessel fills with thick, pasty gruel. Although the gruel tastes like warm, wet cardboard, it is highly nourishing and contains everything @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{necessary to sustain} any herbivorous, omnivorous, or carnivorous creature. The spoon can produce sufficient gruel each day to feed up to four humans.

Price: 5,400 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{Conjure Item};; 2,700 gp.

Universal Solvent

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Universal Solvent]{See item here}

This substance dissolves @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Sovereign Glue]{Sovereign Glue}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Tanglefoot Bag]{Tanglefoot Bags}, and any other adhesive. Applying the solvent is an action.

Price: 50 gp; Weight: —.

Craft: 25 gp.

Wings of Flying

@Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-gear.Wings of Flying]{See item here}

A pair of these wings might appear to be nothing more than a plain cloak of old, black cloth; or they could be as elegant as a long cape of blue feathers. On command, the cloak turns into a pair of bat or bird wings, allowing the wearer to fly at @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} 12. The wings also grant +2 to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} rolls while flying.

Price: 54,000 gp; Weight: 2 lbs.

Craft: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{Fly} 27,000 gp.

05powers00000000.name: Powers
05powers00000000.text:
Powers

Magic is everywhere in Savage Pathfinder. Whether it’s hidden occult lore practiced by dark cultists, the righteous rituals of clerics, or the potent spells of sorcerers and wizards, these rules handle it all in one simple system.

We call all of these effects “powers.” They work the same from game to game, but the particular use, modifiers, and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trappings} give the same core powers endless variations.

Characters gain access to magical powers by taking an Arcane Background, either @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Arcane Background (Magic)]{Magic} or @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Arcane Background (Miracles)]{Miracles} or one of the more specialized Class Edges.

Each type of Arcane Background has the following entries, listed in its description, and may have additional abilities or drawbacks as well.

  • Arcane Skill: This is the skill you roll to activate your powers. Buy it just like any other skill.
  • Starting Powers: This is the number of powers a hero starts with when she takes an Arcane Background. Additional powers may be learned with the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.New Powers]{New Powers} Edge.
  • Power Points: The number of Power Points the character starts with. A hero increases Power Points by taking the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points} Edge.
  • Available Powers: The list of powers characters with that Arcane Background may take.

Detect Magic

In the magically-charged world of Golarion, any character with an Arcane Background can sense magical or divine auras within 5” (10 yards), unless they are magically concealed. This is an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{action}.

Detecting magic at a greater range or gaining specific information requires the detect arcana spell, which can also be used to reveal items or beings protected by conceal arcana. See @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{detect/conceal arcana}

Identifying magic items requires a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Common Knowledge]{Common Knowledge} roll for everyday items like healing potions. More obscure items require an @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Occult]{Occult} roll.

Multiple Arcane Backgrounds

If a character takes a new Arcane Background, she gets a d4 in its arcane skill if she doesn’t already have it and any new powers it grants. If she already has an Arcane Background or Mystic Powers, she doesn’t get new @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points}, she must share her existing pool with all her Arcane Backgrounds and Mystic Powers. Otherwise, she also gets the Power Points listed for the Edge.

Class Edge abilities apply only to spells provided by that class.

Powers.name: Powers
Powers.text:
Powers

On the following pages are a number of powers available in Savage Pathfinder. Each power has the following statistics:

Rank: The @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01makingcharac00]{Rank} a character must be to learn the power.

Power Points: The cost to activate the power in @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Points}.

Range: The maximum distance between the caster and the power’s effect. @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Range} is often expressed as @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} or some multiple thereof. If so, read Smarts as inches on the tabletop (twice that in yards). A Smarts of d10, for example, means the power can be cast up to 10″ (20 yards) away.

Unless the power says otherwise, Range has no effect after the power is activated. An ally who has been granted @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility}, for example, may then move beyond the caster’s Smarts with no ill effect.

Duration: How long the power lasts in rounds (unless otherwise noted).

Powers expire at the end of the character’s turn X rounds later, where X is the Duration listed. Count the round the power activated. If the cleric activates @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{boost trait} (Duration 5) on the second round of combat, for example, it remains in place until the end of her turn on the sixth round.

Powers may be maintained for their base Duration for 1 Power Point per individual.

Unless it says otherwise, the caster can ter­minate a power she’s activated as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free actions}. She must terminate the entire power— she can’t leave it on for some and off for others.

School: The @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{Arcane School} of magic associated with this power.

Trappings: These are descriptive ideas and suggestions for how the power might look or manifest for different characters.

Modifiers: The specific @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifiers} a caster can use when activating the power. Those with the “red star” bullets are Epic Powers. These are unlocked with Arcane and Divine Mastery Class Edges.

Arcane Protection

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: 1

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Abjuration

Trappings: Concentration, a dull glow around the protected character, a fetish.

Success with arcane protection means hostile powers suffer a −2 penalty (−4 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) to affect this character. If the power causes harm, damage is also reduced a like amount.

Arcane protection stacks with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Arcane Resistance]{Arcane Resistance} should the recipient have both!

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Additional Recipients (+1): The power may affect more than one target for 1 additional Power Point each.
  • Greater ARCANE PROTECTION (+2): Hostile powers suffer a −4 penalty (−6 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}).

Baleful Polymorph

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Baleful Polymorph]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3+2 per point of size change

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Transmutation

Trappings: Cursed artifact, a bolt of energy.

Choose a creature with the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Animal (Type)]{Animal} type, from @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size –2 to Size 3}. Baleful Polymorph is an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed roll} of the character's arcane skill versus the target's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit}. With a success, the victim changes into a relatively harmless creature. They gain the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Agility}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Strength}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor}, and innate abilities of the animal, but retain their own @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} and Spirit.

The target must be able to survive in its current environment while in its new form (you cannot turn someone into a fish while on dry land). If the victim @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{critically fails} the Spirit roll, they gain the Smarts of the animal as well, believing that they are an animal until the power ends. At the end of each of the victim's subsequent turns, he can make a Spirit roll at –2 (–4 if the caster got a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}) to return to his normal form.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Duration (+2): The power's @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Duration} is measured in minutes instead of rounds.

Banish

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Banish]{here}.

Rank: Veteran

Power Points: 3

Range: Smarts

Duration: Instant

School: Abjuration

Trappings: Holy items, arcane symbols, handful of salt.

Banish sends entities from other planes back to their native dimensions. This includes ghosts, demons, elementals, and similar beings (at the GM’s discretion).

Banishing a being is an opposed roll of the caster’s arcane skill versus the target’s Spirit. Success means the target is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}, and each @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} causes a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound}.

If this @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitates} the target it returns to its native plane of existence. Banished entities may return when the Game Master feels it’s appropriate, or even a few rounds later if the being has the ability to travel between planes on its own!

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Area of Effect (+1/+2/+3): The power affects everything in a Small, Medium, or Large Blast Template. See @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{area effect attacks} here.

Barrier

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Barrier]{here}.

Rank: Seasoned

Power Points: 2

Range: Smarts

Duration: 5

School: Conjuration

Trappings: Fire, ice, thorns, bones, energy.

Barrier creates a straight wall 5″ (10 yards) long and 1″ (two yards) tall, of immobile material that conforms to the surface it’s cast upon. Double the length with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}.

Thickness varies depending on what the wall is made of, but is usually a few inches.

The wall is Hardness 10 (or 12 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}), and may be destroyed as any other object (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Breaking Things}). Each @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} destroys a 1" (2 yard) square section of wall (piercing weapons can't damage the barrier).

When the spell expires or the wall is broken it crumbles to dust or dissipates. Trap­pings are never left behind.

Modifiers

See generic modifiers @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{here}

  • Damage (+0/+1): The barrier causes 2d4 damage to anyone who contacts it. If the barrier is immaterial, such as with a wall of fire, this modifier costs +0 instead of +1.
  • Deadly (+2): The barrier causes 2d6 damage.
  • Hardened (+1): The wall is Hardness 12 (or 14 with a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}).
  • Shaped (+1): The barrier forms a circle, square, or rectangle. It can't have a roof or floor, and can't Bind or Entangle anything within (use the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Entangle]{entangle} power for that).
  • Size (+1): The length and height of the barrier doubles.

Beast Friend

See power @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Beast Friend]{here}.

Rank: Novice

Power Points: Special

Range: Smarts

Duration: 10 minutes

School: Enchantment

Trappings: The caster concentrates and gestures with his hands.

This spell allows an individual to speak with and guide the actions of nature’s beasts. The cost to cast is equal to the sum of their @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Size} (minimum 1 per creature; see the creatures in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore08bestia.JournalEntryPage.08bestiary000000]{Bestiary} for an example).
